detailed_description: A pipeline for processing and standardising chemical structures, used to generate the Papyrus dataset, handling stereochemistry, salts, and tautomers.

name: CombBLAS
one_line_profile: Distributed-memory parallel graph library for graph analytics
detailed_description: An extensible distributed-memory parallel graph library offering linear algebra primitives for graph analytics, widely used in scientific computing tasks like genome assembly.

name: SpaceHASTEN
one_line_profile: Structure-based virtual screening tool for non-enumerated libraries
detailed_description: A structure-based virtual screening tool designed to handle non-enumerated virtual chemical libraries, enabling efficient exploration of large chemical spaces.

name: STDG-evaluation-metrics
one_line_profile: Standardised metrics for synthetic tabular data evaluation
detailed_description: A toolkit providing standardized metrics and methods to evaluate the quality and utility of synthetic tabular data, applicable in data science and scientific data augmentation contexts.

name: pact_methodology
one_line_profile: Implementation of WBCSD PACT Methodology for Product Carbon Footprints
detailed_description: A Python implementation of the WBCSD PACT Methodology for calculating and standardizing Product Carbon Footprints (PCF), supporting environmental science and sustainability research.

name: openbabel-gem
one_line_profile: Ruby wrapper for the OpenBabel chemistry library
detailed_description: A Ruby Gem providing bindings to the OpenBabel chemistry library, enabling chemical file conversion and processing within Ruby applications.

name: DeDup
one_line_profile: Merged read deduplication tool for NGS data
detailed_description: A Java-based tool for performing deduplication on merged single-end reads in Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) data, addressing specific biases in ancient DNA or specific library protocols.

name: AWS Ambit Scenario Designer
one_line_profile: Scenario designer for autonomous vehicle and robotics simulation in UE4
detailed_description: A suite of tools for Unreal Engine 4 to streamline the creation of complex scenarios for autonomous vehicle and robotics simulations, supporting large-scale content generation.

name: ChemLG
one_line_profile: Massive parallel molecular library generator
detailed_description: A smart and massively parallel molecular library generator designed for chemical and materials sciences, capable of generating diverse chemical structures for high-throughput screening.

name: ESP-Sim
one_line_profile: Electrostatic potential and shape similarity scoring
detailed_description: A Python tool using RDKit to calculate and score the similarity of molecules based on 3D shape and Electrostatic Potential (ESP), useful for virtual screening and bioisostere replacement.

name: ClustTraj
one_line_profile: Clustering tool for molecular dynamics trajectories
detailed_description: A Python script that performs agglomerative clustering on molecular dynamics or Monte Carlo trajectories to classify and analyze similar structural conformations.

name: ugropy
one_line_profile: UNIFAC-like group detection for thermodynamics
detailed_description: A Python library that identifies UNIFAC-like functional groups in molecules from their names or structures, facilitating input generation for thermodynamic models like UNIFAC, PSRK, and Joback.

name: SMILESAugmentation
one_line_profile: Data augmentation for chemical SMILES strings
detailed_description: A Python tool for augmenting chemical datasets by generating variations of SMILES, SELFIES, and Reaction SMILES, useful for training machine learning models in chemistry.

name: pySiRC
one_line_profile: Reaction rate constant prediction tool
detailed_description: A web application and library for predicting reaction rate constants using machine learning models based on molecular fingerprints.

name: spyn
one_line_profile: SSNMR shield tensor calculation and conformer generation
detailed_description: A software suite for calculating solid-state NMR shield tensors using the GIPAW method, visualizing spectra, and generating conformers using genetic algorithms.

name: Ambit (Tensor)
one_line_profile: Tensor product calculation library for quantum chemistry
detailed_description: A C++ library designed for the efficient implementation of tensor product calculations, primarily used in the development of quantum chemistry software for electronic structure theory.

name: MODIFY
one_line_profile: ML-optimized library design for protein engineering
detailed_description: ML-optimized library design with improved fitness and diversity for protein engineering applications.

name: Ambit
one_line_profile: FEniCSx-based cardiovascular multi-physics solver
detailed_description: A FEniCSx-based cardiovascular multi-physics solver for modeling heart mechanics and hemodynamics.

name: Reaction Network
one_line_profile: Predicting inorganic chemical reaction pathways
detailed_description: A Python package for predicting likely inorganic chemical reaction pathways using graph theoretical methods.

name: NuDup
one_line_profile: PCR duplicate removal tool for NGS data using molecular tags
detailed_description: A tool designed to mark and remove duplicate molecules in Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) data, specifically leveraging molecular tagging technology (UMIs) to distinguish true biological duplicates from PCR artifacts.

name: DataWarrior
one_line_profile: Interactive data analysis and visualization software for chemistry
detailed_description: A comprehensive desktop application for data visualization and analysis with embedded chemical intelligence, supporting structure-activity relationship (SAR) analysis, library design, and property prediction.

name: Pharmacophore Toolkit
one_line_profile: Toolkit for generating pharmacophore models from molecular data
detailed_description: A collection of tools and scripts based on RDKit to generate, visualize, and analyze pharmacophore models for drug discovery applications.

name: RDMC
one_line_profile: Package for handling reaction data and molecular conformers
detailed_description: Reaction Data and Molecular Conformers (RDMC) is a Python package designed to handle chemical reactions, molecules, and their 3D conformers, facilitating complex computational chemistry workflows.

name: SigDigger
one_line_profile: Qt-based digital signal analyzer for signal processing and reverse engineering
detailed_description: A digital signal analyzer that allows users to inspect, analyze, and reverse engineer digital signals. It supports various DSP operations and visualization of signal data.

name: SMILES2PropertiesTransformer
one_line_profile: Transformer-based model for predicting chemical properties from SMILES
detailed_description: An implementation of a transformer model designed to predict limiting activity coefficients and other properties directly from SMILES strings using natural language processing techniques.

name: MMELON
one_line_profile: Multi-view Molecular Embedding with Late Fusion architecture
detailed_description: Implementation of the MMELON architecture which combines molecular representations from image, graph, and text views to learn a joint embedding for downstream chemical and biological property prediction.

name: RxnIM
one_line_profile: Multimodal Large Language Model for chemical reaction image parsing
detailed_description: A tool leveraging a multimodal Large Language Model to parse chemical reaction images and convert them into structured data formats.

name: MaskGAE
one_line_profile: Masked Graph Modeling for Graph Autoencoders
detailed_description: A self-supervised learning framework for graph data that uses masked graph modeling to improve graph autoencoders, applicable to molecular graph representation learning.

name: MolFlux
one_line_profile: Foundational package for molecular predictive modelling
detailed_description: A library developed by Exscientia for building, training, and evaluating molecular predictive models, serving as a foundation for drug discovery workflows.

name: iMoLD
one_line_profile: Learning Invariant Molecular Representation in Latent Discrete Space
detailed_description: A framework for learning invariant molecular representations using a latent discrete space, designed to improve molecular property prediction and generation tasks.

name: DrugGEN
one_line_profile: Target Specific De Novo Design of Drug Candidate Molecules
detailed_description: A graph transformer-based generative adversarial network for the target-specific de novo design of drug candidate molecules.

name: EquiBind
one_line_profile: Geometric deep learning for fast 3D molecular docking
detailed_description: A geometric deep learning model for fast and accurate prediction of the 3D structure of small molecule-protein complexes (docking).

name: VideoMol
one_line_profile: Molecular Video-derived Foundation Model for Drug Discovery
detailed_description: A foundation model that leverages molecular videos to learn representations for scientific drug discovery tasks.

name: MolFormer
one_line_profile: Large-scale chemical language model for molecular representation
detailed_description: A large-scale chemical language model developed by IBM designed to learn molecular representations from SMILES strings for various downstream tasks.

name: DECIMER Image Transformer
one_line_profile: Automated recognition of chemical structure images to SMILES
detailed_description: A deep learning tool that converts images of chemical structures into SMILES strings, enabling the digitization of chemical data from literature and patents.

name: UnityMol
one_line_profile: Molecular viewer and visualization software for biological macromolecules
detailed_description: UnityMol is a molecular viewer and visualization prototyping platform developed using the Unity game engine. It supports high-quality rendering of molecular structures, electrostatic potential maps, and other chemical data, providing immersive visualization capabilities for structural biology and chemistry.

name: MolBART
one_line_profile: Transformer-based molecular representation model for SMILES transformation
detailed_description: MolBART is a pre-trained sequence-to-sequence transformer model designed for molecular SMILES transformation tasks. Developed by MolecularAI (AstraZeneca), it utilizes the BART architecture to learn continuous molecular representations, enabling fine-tuning for diverse downstream tasks in drug discovery such as property prediction and reaction prediction.

name: KERMT
one_line_profile: Pretrained graph neural network for molecular property prediction
detailed_description: KERMT is a deep learning model developed by NVIDIA Digital Bio that utilizes graph neural networks (GNNs) for molecular representation learning. It is pre-trained on large-scale molecular datasets to provide high-quality embeddings for downstream molecular property prediction tasks.

name: ChemDFM
one_line_profile: Dialogue foundation model for chemistry and molecular science
detailed_description: ChemDFM is an open-source large language model (LLM) specifically fine-tuned for the chemistry domain. It is designed to handle dialogue-based tasks involving chemical knowledge, molecular understanding, and scientific reasoning, bridging the gap between general LLMs and specialized chemical tasks.

name: CD-GPT
one_line_profile: Biological foundation model bridging molecular sequences via Central Dogma
detailed_description: CD-GPT is a biological foundation model developed by Tencent AI4S that aims to bridge the gap between different molecular sequences (DNA, RNA, Protein) following the Central Dogma of biology. It facilitates cross-modal representation learning and generation tasks in bioinformatics and molecular biology.

name: HiMolformer
one_line_profile: Hybrid GNN and Transformer model for predicting liver microsome stability using SMILES
detailed_description: A hybrid deep learning model that combines Graph Neural Networks (GNN) and Transformer architectures to process molecular representations (SMILES) for predicting liver microsome stability, a key pharmacokinetic property.

name: MoleBlend
one_line_profile: Multimodal molecular pretraining framework via modality blending
detailed_description: Implementation of the ICLR 2024 paper 'Multimodal Molecular Pretraining via Modality Blending'. It provides a framework for pretraining molecular representations by blending different modalities (e.g., graphs, text) to enhance downstream task performance.

name: SmileCode
one_line_profile: Deformable image registration tool using Motion Decomposition Transformer
detailed_description: Code for the MICCAI 2023 paper 'ModeT', focusing on learning deformable image registration via a Motion Decomposition Transformer. While the lab name contains 'SMILE', the tool is for medical image analysis.

name: MSformer
one_line_profile: Molecular representation framework via meta structures
detailed_description: A deep learning framework for molecular representation learning that utilizes meta-structures to capture complex molecular patterns and dependencies.

name: HM-GNN
one_line_profile: Molecular representation learning via Heterogeneous Motif Graph Neural Networks
detailed_description: Official PyTorch implementation of HM-GNN, a method for learning molecular representations by leveraging heterogeneous motif graphs to capture multi-scale structural information.

name: bertify-umls
one_line_profile: Toolkit for training BERT models on UMLS knowledge graph and corpora
detailed_description: A toolkit designed to jointly train BERT encoder models on the UMLS metathesaurus knowledge graph and free-text corpora, enabling graph-based reasoning tasks alongside masked language modeling for biomedical informatics.

name: MCGLPPI
one_line_profile: Protein-protein complex property prediction using coarse-grained models
detailed_description: Integration of molecular coarse-grained models into a geometric representation learning framework for predicting properties of protein-protein complexes.

name: WebPlotDigitizer
one_line_profile: Tool to extract numerical data from plot images
detailed_description: A web-based tool that uses computer vision techniques to extract underlying numerical data from images of plots and charts, widely used for data recovery in scientific research.

name: Carmen
one_line_profile: Context-aware safe medication recommendation system
detailed_description: Implementation of the AAAI-23 paper 'Carmen', a system for safe medication recommendations that utilizes molecular graph and drug-drug interaction (DDI) graph embeddings.

name: virtues
one_line_profile: Foundation model framework for multiplexed tissue imaging data
detailed_description: A framework for analyzing multiplexed tissue imaging data across molecular, cellular, and tissue scales, facilitating clinical diagnostics and biological discovery.

name: Dendriform.jl
one_line_profile: Algorithms for dendriform di-algebras and planar binary trees
detailed_description: A Julia library for computing with Loday's arithmetic on groves of planar binary trees using dendriform di-algebra algorithms, useful in algebraic combinatorics and related mathematical fields.

name: NovoMolGen
one_line_profile: Molecular language model pretraining framework
detailed_description: Code for the paper 'NovoMolGen: Rethinking Molecular Language Model Pretraining', providing methods for generative pretraining of molecular language models.

name: GeoSSL
one_line_profile: Molecular geometry pretraining with SE(3)-invariant denoising
detailed_description: Implementation of GeoSSL (ICLR'23), a self-supervised learning framework for molecular geometry pretraining using SE(3)-invariant denoising distance matching.

name: GraphMVP
one_line_profile: Pre-training molecular graph representation with 3D geometry
detailed_description: Implementation of GraphMVP (ICLR'22), a framework for pre-training molecular graph representations by incorporating 3D geometric information.

name: qcf
one_line_profile: Quantum computing functions toolbox for Octave/Matlab
detailed_description: A toolbox for simulating quantum computing algorithms (e.g., Grover, Deutsch) based on Nielsen & Chuang's textbook, compatible with Octave and Matlab.

name: CombinatorialAuctions
one_line_profile: Implementation of combinatorial auction protocols (VCG, Groves)
detailed_description: A library implementing and evaluating combinatorial auction protocols such as VCG and Groves mechanisms, useful for economic modeling and algorithmic game theory research.

name: TreeExtra
one_line_profile: Additive Groves and Bagged Trees implementation
detailed_description: Implementation of Additive Groves and Bagged Trees algorithms, including tools for feature evaluation, interaction detection, and visualization of feature effects in statistical learning.

name: Uni-Mol
one_line_profile: Universal 3D molecular representation learning framework
detailed_description: Official repository for Uni-Mol, a universal 3D molecular representation learning framework that can be applied to various tasks in drug design and materials science.

name: DIG
one_line_profile: Library for graph deep learning research
detailed_description: A comprehensive library for graph deep learning research, including modules for graph generation, explanation, and 3D graph learning, widely applicable in scientific domains like chemistry.

name: Evo
one_line_profile: Biological foundation modeling from molecular to genome scale
detailed_description: A genomic foundation model capable of generating DNA, RNA, and protein sequences, enabling prediction and design tasks across molecular biology scales.

name: 3D-EMGP

detailed_description: An implementation of energy-motivated equivariant pretraining for 3D molecular graphs, designed to improve molecular property prediction and representation.

name: DeePhase
one_line_profile: Predictor of homotypic liquid-liquid phase separation of proteins
detailed_description: A tool for predicting liquid-liquid phase separation (LLPS) of proteins based on sequence determinants and embeddings, associated with PNAS publication.

name: Retrosynthesis-Prediction
one_line_profile: Retrosynthesis reaction prediction using Transformer models
detailed_description: A sequence-to-sequence transformer model implementation for predicting retrosynthetic routes from chemical products.

name: Graph-DiT

detailed_description: A diffusion transformer model specifically designed for generating molecular graphs under multiple conditional constraints.

name: InfoAlign

detailed_description: A framework for learning molecular representations by aligning molecular structures with cellular context or information.

name: Molecule Attention Transformer (MAT)

detailed_description: A PyTorch reimplementation of the Molecule Attention Transformer (MAT), which utilizes a transformer architecture to process and learn from the graph-like structure of molecules for various chemical tasks.

name: GraphFP

name: ApeTokenizer

name: MolE (Recursion)

detailed_description: A repository collecting various molecular datasets intended for validating and benchmarking molecular property inference models.

name: MolCap-Arena

detailed_description: A comprehensive molecular benchmark dataset tailored for disease and target-based machine learning tasks in drug discovery.

detailed_description: A molecular property prediction model that fuses molecular language and graph representations to achieve enhanced predictive performance.

name: alchemical-analysis

detailed_description: An open tool implementing recommended practices for analyzing alchemical free energy calculations in computational chemistry.

name: GraphINVENT

detailed_description: A platform using graph neural networks for graph-based molecular design and generation.

name: MolScore

detailed_description: An automated scoring function designed to facilitate and standardize the evaluation of goal-directed generative models for de novo molecular design.

name: ProfBench

detailed_description: A PhD/MBA-level human-annotated rubrics dataset covering Physics, Chemistry, Finance, and Consulting, serving as a benchmark for expert-level reasoning.

name: LLM4Chem

detailed_description: A comprehensive instruction tuning dataset (LlaSMol) and associated code designed to advance Large Language Models' capabilities in chemistry tasks.

name: paccmann_datasets

detailed_description: A library providing specialized PyTorch dataset implementations for handling drug sensitivity data, supporting the PaccMann ecosystem.

name: PickyBinder

detailed_description: A workflow designed to benchmark various molecular docking tools, facilitating the evaluation of docking performance and accuracy.

name: uq_molecule

detailed_description: A library implementing Bayesian deep learning methods to quantify uncertainty in molecular property predictions.

name: mol_property

detailed_description: A tool for predicting pKa values from chemical structures using machine learning approaches and molecular similarity.

name: HimGNN

detailed_description: Implementation of the HimGNN model for molecular property prediction, utilizing a hierarchical approach to learn molecular representations.

name: SGGRL

detailed_description: Implementation of SGGRL, a framework integrating sequence, graph, and geometry information for molecular property prediction.

name: Ouroboros

detailed_description: A foundational model for drug discovery that bridges representation learning and generative AI to navigate molecular encoding space.

name: SigmaCCS

name: FraGAT

name: GeomGCL

detailed_description: Implementation of GeomGCL, a geometric graph contrastive learning method for enhancing molecular property prediction.

name: Tartarus

detailed_description: A benchmarking platform designed to evaluate realistic and practical inverse molecular design models, focusing on optimizability, diversity, and property prediction in chemical space.

name: dionysus

name: Graph Network Explainability

name: MolNet Geometric Lightning

detailed_description: An implementation of MoleculeNet benchmarks utilizing PyTorch Lightning and Torch Geometric, providing a standardized workflow for evaluating molecular property prediction models.

name: MDBenchmark

name: YANK

name: MoleculeNet

name: Geo-DEG

name: cyclic-peptides

detailed_description: A dataset and associated scripts for benchmarking docking protocols on cyclic peptide-protein complexes.

name: Guacamole (HammerLab)
one_line_profile: Spark-based somatic variant calling tool
detailed_description: A somatic variant caller for NGS data built on Apache Spark, supporting multi-sample calling and local assembly.

name: HiGNN
one_line_profile: Hierarchical Informative Graph Neural Network for molecules
detailed_description: A hierarchical graph neural network model equipped with feature-wise attention for molecular property prediction.

name: Drug ID Mapping
one_line_profile: Tool for cross-matching drug identifiers across multiple databases
detailed_description: A utility to map and cross-match drug identifiers between major chemical databases including DrugBank, ChEMBL, PubChem, ZINC, and KEGG.

name: AIMNet-X2D
one_line_profile: Scalable 2D GNN framework for molecular property prediction
detailed_description: A scalable 2D Graph Neural Network framework designed for efficient and accurate molecular property prediction, developed by the Isayev Lab.

name: SFL
one_line_profile: Out-of-distribution molecular representation learning framework
detailed_description: Implementation of a method for stretching the boundaries of structure and property coverage to improve out-of-distribution generalization in molecular representation learning.

name: Lipophilicity Prediction
one_line_profile: Multitask learning model for lipophilicity prediction
detailed_description: Code for predicting lipophilicity using multitask learning and molecular substructure representations, presented at NeurIPS 2020 ML for Molecules Workshop.

name: Carbon Data
one_line_profile: Dataset of 22.9 million carbon atom environments
detailed_description: A large-scale dataset containing 22.9 million carbon atom environments, useful for training machine learning potentials or analyzing carbon structures.

name: Molecule Chef
one_line_profile: Generative model for synthesizable molecules
detailed_description: Implementation of 'A Model to Search for Synthesizable Molecules', designed to generate molecular structures that are chemically synthesizable.

name: IFM
one_line_profile: Deep model for molecular property prediction (NeurIPS 2023)
detailed_description: Code for the NeurIPS 2023 paper 'Understanding the Limitations of Deep Models for Molecular Property Prediction', providing improved modeling approaches.

name: ChemBench
one_line_profile: Automated benchmark framework for evaluating LLMs on chemistry tasks
detailed_description: ChemBench is a framework designed to evaluate the capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) in the domain of chemistry. It provides a suite of tasks and metrics to assess how well LLMs perform on chemical reasoning, knowledge retrieval, and problem-solving.

name: molecularGNN_3Dstructure
one_line_profile: Graph Neural Network for molecular property prediction using 3D structures
detailed_description: A Graph Neural Network (GNN) implementation that explicitly incorporates 3D molecular structural information for predicting molecular properties. It serves as a solver for structure-property relationship modeling in computational chemistry.

name: a3fe
one_line_profile: Automated Adaptive Absolute alchemical Free Energy calculator
detailed_description: A3FE is a Python tool for automating the calculation of absolute alchemical free energies. It manages the setup and execution of molecular dynamics simulations required for free energy perturbation (FEP) or thermodynamic integration (TI) methods.

name: FS-Mol
one_line_profile: Few-Shot Learning Dataset and Benchmark for Molecules
detailed_description: FS-Mol is a comprehensive dataset and benchmark suite designed for few-shot learning in drug discovery. It contains molecular compounds with activity measurements against various protein targets, enabling the evaluation of models that learn from limited data.

name: TDC
one_line_profile: Therapeutics Data Commons: Multimodal Foundation for Therapeutic Science
detailed_description: Therapeutics Data Commons (TDC) is a comprehensive platform providing datasets and benchmarks for therapeutic machine learning. It covers a wide range of modalities and stages in drug discovery, including ADMET prediction, drug-target interaction, and molecular generation.

name: MOSES
one_line_profile: Benchmarking platform for molecular generation models
detailed_description: Molecular Sets (MOSES) is a benchmarking platform to evaluate and compare machine learning models for molecular generation. It provides standard datasets, metrics, and baseline models to ensure reproducible research in generative chemistry.

name: chem-dcat-ap
one_line_profile: Metadata schema and extension for describing chemistry datasets
detailed_description: An extension of the DCAT Application Profile combined with LinkML schema, designed by NFDI4Chem to provide standardized, chemistry-specific metadata for dataset description and interoperability.

name: Antibody-Antigen Docking Benchmark
one_line_profile: Benchmark dataset and tools for antibody-antigen docking and affinity prediction
detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark suite designed to evaluate computational methods for antibody-antigen docking and affinity prediction, facilitating the development of biologics.

name: FragNet
one_line_profile: Graph Neural Network for interpretable molecular property prediction
detailed_description: A Graph Neural Network architecture designed for molecular property prediction that offers four levels of interpretability, aiding in the understanding of structure-property relationships.

name: qm9pack
one_line_profile: Python package for mining and handling the QM9 dataset
detailed_description: A utility package designed to facilitate data mining and handling of the QM9 quantum chemistry dataset, streamlining access to molecular properties.

name: smilite
one_line_profile: Lightweight interface for ZINC database SMILES retrieval
detailed_description: A Python module that provides a simple interface to retrieve and compare SMILES strings of chemical compounds directly from the ZINC online database.

name: Smiles2Dock
one_line_profile: Large-scale multi-task dataset for molecular docking
detailed_description: A large-scale, multi-task dataset specifically curated for training and evaluating machine learning models for molecular docking tasks.

name: rxn-reaction-preprocessing
one_line_profile: Preprocessing utilities for chemical reaction datasets
detailed_description: A library for standardizing, filtering, augmenting, and tokenizing chemical reaction datasets, preparing them for machine learning models.

name: MADD
one_line_profile: Multi-agent system for drug discovery tasks
detailed_description: A multi-agent system framework designed to automate and optimize various tasks within the drug discovery pipeline.

name: LigEGFR
one_line_profile: Dataset and embedding for EGFR ligand bioactivity prediction
detailed_description: A dataset and spatial graph embedding methodology for predicting the bioactivity of ligand molecules targeting the epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR).

name: MolPILE
one_line_profile: Large-scale diverse dataset for molecular representation learning
detailed_description: A large-scale and diverse dataset specifically curated to support and benchmark molecular representation learning models.

name: Benchmarking Molecular Models
one_line_profile: Code for benchmarking pretrained molecular embedding models
detailed_description: A repository containing the code and framework used for benchmarking various pretrained molecular embedding models, as presented in the associated research paper.

name: ACANet
one_line_profile: Activity-Cliff Awareness Graph Learning for Molecular Property Prediction
detailed_description: A deep learning framework (Activity-Cliff Awareness Network) designed to improve molecular property prediction by explicitly handling activity cliffs in molecular graphs.

name: matbench-genmetrics
one_line_profile: Metrics for benchmarking generative materials models
detailed_description: A Python library providing standardized metrics for evaluating generative models in materials science, inspired by Guacamol for chemistry.

name: SpectroChemPy
one_line_profile: Framework for processing and analyzing spectroscopic data
detailed_description: A Python framework dedicated to processing, analyzing, and modeling various types of spectroscopic data (IR, NMR, UV-Vis, etc.) in chemistry.

name: PAR-NeurIPS21
one_line_profile: Property-Aware Relation Networks for molecular property prediction
detailed_description: Implementation of Property-Aware Relation Networks (PAR) for few-shot molecular property prediction, as presented at NeurIPS 2021.

name: mddatasetbuilder
one_line_profile: Dataset builder for neural network potentials from MD trajectories
detailed_description: A tool to construct reference datasets for training neural network potentials by processing LAMMPS molecular dynamics trajectories.

name: trident-chemwidgets
one_line_profile: Jupyter Widgets for interactive molecular dataset visualization
detailed_description: A set of Jupyter widgets designed to facilitate the interactive exploration and visualization of molecular datasets within notebooks.

name: soapgp
one_line_profile: Molecular property prediction using Gaussian Processes with SOAP kernel
detailed_description: A Python implementation for predicting molecular properties using Gaussian Processes combined with the Smooth Overlap of Atomic Positions (SOAP) kernel.

name: Knowledge-based-BERT
one_line_profile: K-BERT model for molecular property prediction
detailed_description: Implementation of Knowledge-based BERT (K-BERT) adapted for molecular property prediction tasks, integrating domain knowledge into the pre-training.

name: GLAM
one_line_profile: Adaptive graph learning method for molecular interactions and properties predictions
detailed_description: GLAM (Graph Learning with Adaptive Mechanisms) is a deep learning framework designed to predict molecular interactions and properties by utilizing adaptive graph learning techniques to capture complex molecular structures.

name: Molecular-graph-BERT
one_line_profile: Semi-supervised learning for molecular property prediction using BERT architecture
detailed_description: This tool adapts the BERT architecture for molecular graphs, enabling semi-supervised learning to predict molecular properties by capturing structural dependencies within molecules.

name: Meta-MGNN
one_line_profile: Few-Shot Graph Learning for Molecular Property Prediction
detailed_description: Meta-MGNN is a meta-learning framework designed for molecular property prediction in few-shot scenarios, allowing the model to generalize to new tasks with limited labeled data.

name: MOKIT
one_line_profile: Molecular Orbital Kit for orbital transfer and multi-reference calculations
detailed_description: MOKIT (Molecular Orbital KIT) provides utilities to transfer molecular orbitals between various quantum chemistry software packages and perform automatic multi-reference calculations. It addresses the compatibility issues between different wavefunction formats.

name: coqui
one_line_profile: Ab initio electronic structure software beyond DFT
detailed_description: Coqui is an ab initio electronic structure package designed for calculations beyond standard density functional theory, implemented in C++ for performance.

name: xtb_ase
one_line_profile: ASE calculator interface for the xTB semi-empirical quantum chemistry code
detailed_description: A Python library that provides a fully featured Atomic Simulation Environment (ASE) calculator for the Extended Tight Binding (xTB) program, enabling geometry optimizations and dynamics using xTB within ASE workflows.

name: ebcc
one_line_profile: Coupled cluster models for electron and electron-boson systems
detailed_description: ebcc is a Python-based code for coupled cluster calculations, supporting both purely electronic systems and coupled electron-boson models. It emphasizes generality and extensibility for research in quantum many-body theory.

name: Quax
one_line_profile: Automatic differentiation for electronic structure methods
detailed_description: Quax provides arbitrary-order derivatives of popular electronic structure methods (Hartree-Fock, Coupled Cluster) using automatic differentiation techniques, facilitating property calculations and optimization.

name: CPMD
one_line_profile: Car-Parrinello Molecular Dynamics package
detailed_description: CPMD is a parallelized plane wave/pseudopotential implementation of Density Functional Theory, specifically designed for ab-initio molecular dynamics (Car-Parrinello method). It is a long-standing and widely used code in computational chemistry.

name: Gaussium
one_line_profile: Python-based Quantum Chemistry program
detailed_description: Gaussium is a quantum chemistry program written in Python 3 that supports various methods including RHF, UHF, TDHF, CIS, MP2, DFT, CCSD, and CCSD(T), serving as a flexible solver for electronic structure problems.

name: pycc
one_line_profile: Reference implementation of coupled cluster methods
detailed_description: PyCC is a Python-based reference implementation of the coupled cluster method for ab initio quantum chemistry, designed for educational purposes and as a testbed for new ideas in many-body theory.

name: DMFTwDFT
one_line_profile: Combination of DMFT with DFT packages
detailed_description: DMFTwDFT is an open-source code that combines Dynamical Mean Field Theory (DMFT) with various Density Functional Theory (DFT) packages to treat strongly correlated electron systems.

name: vaspvis
one_line_profile: Visualization library for VASP electronic structure data
detailed_description: vaspvis is a flexible Python library for visualizing electronic structure data (such as band structures and DOS) generated by VASP calculations, offering high customizability for publication-quality plots.

name: PROFESS
one_line_profile: Orbital-Free Electronic Structure Software
detailed_description: PROFESS (PRinceton Orbital-Free Electronic Structure Software) is a code for performing orbital-free density functional theory (OF-DFT) calculations, enabling simulation of large systems where standard KS-DFT is too expensive.

name: libxc
one_line_profile: Library of exchange-correlation functionals for DFT
detailed_description: Libxc is a library of exchange-correlation functionals for density-functional theory. It supports a wide variety of functionals (LDA, GGA, meta-GGA, hybrids) and is used by many major quantum chemistry codes.

name: exachem
one_line_profile: Exascale Quantum Chemistry Software
detailed_description: ExaChem is an open-source quantum chemistry software package designed for exascale computing environments, focusing on high-performance implementations of electronic structure methods.

name: Fermi.jl
one_line_profile: Quantum chemistry framework in Julia
detailed_description: Fermi.jl is a modern quantum chemistry framework written in the Julia programming language, offering high performance and ease of development for electronic structure methods.

name: ECCE
one_line_profile: Extensible Computational Chemistry Environment
detailed_description: ECCE is a comprehensive problem-solving environment for computational chemistry, providing a graphical user interface for setting up calculations, managing jobs, and analyzing results from various quantum chemistry codes.

name: ExPecto
one_line_profile: Ab initio prediction of gene expression from sequence
detailed_description: ExPecto is a deep learning framework that predicts tissue-specific gene expression directly from genetic sequences and estimates the disease impact of variants. (Note: Domain is Bioinformatics/Genomics, not Quantum Chemistry).

name: GQCP
one_line_profile: Ghent Quantum Chemistry Package
detailed_description: The Ghent Quantum Chemistry Package (GQCP) is a software tool for performing electronic structure calculations, developed at Ghent University.

name: pymatgen-io-espresso
one_line_profile: Pymatgen addon for Quantum ESPRESSO I/O
detailed_description: A specialized addon for the Pymatgen library that enhances support for parsing and generating input/output files for the Quantum ESPRESSO software suite.

name: HopTB.jl
one_line_profile: Tight-binding package in Julia
detailed_description: HopTB.jl is a Julia package designed for performing tight-binding calculations, allowing for the construction and analysis of tight-binding models in condensed matter physics.

name: TBFIT
one_line_profile: Tight-binding parameter fitting package
detailed_description: TBFIT is a package for fitting tight-binding parameters using the Slater-Koster method, facilitating the creation of accurate tight-binding models from first-principles data.

name: AtomicOrbitals
one_line_profile: Accurate Hartree-Fock Slater orbitals for atoms
detailed_description: A Python module that implements accurate Hartree-Fock Slater orbitals for atoms under spherical symmetry, useful for generating atomic basis sets or initial guesses.

name: LobsterPy
one_line_profile: Automatic bonding analysis for LOBSTER
detailed_description: LobsterPy is a Python package that automates the analysis of outputs from the LOBSTER program (Local Orbital Basis Suite Towards Electronic-Structure Reconstruction), enabling high-throughput bonding analysis.

name: pyscf_TDDFT_ris
one_line_profile: Efficient TDDFT-ris implementation based on MOKIT and PySCF
detailed_description: A Python implementation of the efficient TDDFT-ris method, leveraging MOKIT and PySCF libraries for quantum chemistry calculations.

name: aiida-fleur

detailed_description: A plugin for the AiiDA workflow engine that interfaces with the FLEUR code, enabling high-throughput density functional theory calculations.

name: aiida-kkr

detailed_description: A plugin for the AiiDA workflow engine that interfaces with the JuKKR code (KKR method), facilitating high-throughput electronic structure calculations.

name: DFTK.jl
one_line_profile: Density-functional toolkit in Julia
detailed_description: A library of Julia algorithms for playing with plane-wave density-functional theory (DFT), providing a flexible platform for electronic structure calculations.

name: qcmath

detailed_description: A collection of Mathematica modules designed to assist with electronic structure calculations and quantum chemistry derivations.

name: Quantum Package

detailed_description: An open-source programming environment for quantum chemistry, focusing on wave function methods and configuration interaction.

name: Qball

name: QuantumFoca.jl

detailed_description: A Julia repository for calculating Molecular Integrals based on the O-ohata and Macmurchie-Davidson methods.

name: AutoSolvate

detailed_description: An automated workflow tool for generating quantum chemistry calculations of explicitly solvated molecules, streamlining the setup of solvation shells.

name: qeAPI

detailed_description: A Python interface/API for interacting with Quantum ESPRESSO, facilitating data exchange and automation.

name: Express.jl
one_line_profile: Workflow framework for ab initio calculations
detailed_description: A high-level, extensible workflow framework written in Julia for accelerating ab initio calculations in materials science.

name: qha

detailed_description: A Python package for calculating thermodynamic properties under the quasi-harmonic approximation using data from ab-initio calculations.

name: basis_set_exchange
one_line_profile: Library for quantum chemistry basis sets
detailed_description: A Python library and repository for accessing and managing quantum chemistry basis sets, providing a unified interface for various formats.

name: QCElemental
one_line_profile: Core data structures for quantum chemistry
detailed_description: A library providing periodic table data, physical constants, and molecule parsing utilities for quantum chemistry applications.

name: QCEngine

detailed_description: A compute backend that interfaces with various quantum chemistry programs, standardizing input/output via QCSchema.

name: QCFractal
one_line_profile: Distributed compute platform for quantum chemistry
detailed_description: A distributed compute and database platform for quantum chemistry, managing high-throughput calculations and data storage.

name: OpenMolcas
one_line_profile: Multiconfigurational quantum chemistry software
detailed_description: An open-source quantum chemistry software package specializing in multiconfigurational approaches to electronic structure.

name: NWChemEx
one_line_profile: Exascale-ready quantum chemistry software
detailed_description: The next-generation, exascale-computing focused version of the NWChem computational chemistry software, designed for high-performance electronic structure calculations.

name: ORCA Compound Scripts

detailed_description: A collection of scripts designed to facilitate and automate complex calculation workflows using the ORCA quantum chemistry software package.

name: PARSEC Matlab
one_line_profile: MATLAB implementation of the PARSEC real-space electronic structure code
detailed_description: A MATLAB-based electronic structure code for molecules and clusters using real-space pseudopotentials and density functional theory (DFT).

name: PennyLane

detailed_description: A cross-platform Python library for quantum computing, quantum machine learning, and quantum chemistry, enabling differentiable programming of quantum circuits.

name: PennyLane-Rigetti
one_line_profile: PennyLane plugin for Rigetti Forest QPUs and simulators
detailed_description: A plugin for PennyLane that enables optimization of quantum circuits on Rigetti Forest QPUs, QVM, and wavefunction simulators.

name: DFTTK
one_line_profile: Density functional theory workflows for finite temperature thermodynamics
detailed_description: A Python package providing density functional theory (DFT) workflows based on Atomate for calculating finite temperature thermodynamic properties of materials.

name: FermiLib-Plugin-Psi4
one_line_profile: Psi4 plugin for FermiLib
detailed_description: A plugin enabling the use of the Psi4 quantum chemistry package within the FermiLib ecosystem for quantum computing applications.

name: FermiLib-Plugin-PySCF

detailed_description: A plugin enabling the use of the PySCF quantum chemistry package within the FermiLib ecosystem for quantum computing applications.

detailed_description: A Python library for automating routine tasks in quantum chemistry, including input generation, output parsing, and structure manipulation.

name: Quantum ESPRESSO

detailed_description: An integrated suite of Open-Source computer codes for electronic-structure calculations and materials modeling at the nanoscale, based on density-functional theory, plane waves, and pseudopotentials.

name: Quantum ESPRESSO for Schrdinger

detailed_description: A specialized version of Quantum ESPRESSO designed for integration into Schrdingers Materials Science Suite workflows.

detailed_description: Python tools for handling and validating XML Schema based documents generated by Quantum ESPRESSO.

detailed_description: A tool to calculate ab initio spin-orbital coupling strength for Wannier tight-binding models.

detailed_description: A quantum Monte Carlo (QMC) code for electronic structure calculations of atoms, molecules, and solids.

name: QMCPACK

detailed_description: An open-source, high-performance many-body ab initio Quantum Monte Carlo code for computing the electronic structure of atoms, molecules, and solids, with GPU support.

name: Hefei-NAMD

detailed_description: A software package for performing ab-initio nonadiabatic molecular dynamics simulations to study excited state dynamics.

name: pyscf-ac0

detailed_description: An extension for the PySCF library implementing the CAS-AC0 method for electronic structure calculations.

name: quacc

detailed_description: A platform for building and running complex computational materials science and quantum chemistry workflows, designed for high-throughput and big data applications.

name: TightBindingApproximation.jl

detailed_description: A Julia library for modeling and simulating quantum lattice systems using the tight-binding approximation.

name: RMG

detailed_description: An open-source electronic structure code based on density functional theory (DFT) using real-space bases and pseudopotentials, suitable for materials and molecules.

name: ASH

detailed_description: A flexible Python environment for computational chemistry, focusing on QM/MM calculations for molecules, crystals, and proteins.

name: ML-DFT

name: SOAPLite

name: pycp2k

detailed_description: A Python interface for the CP2K quantum chemistry and solid state physics software package, enabling scripted control of simulations.

name: Sumo

detailed_description: A toolkit for generating publication-quality plots (band structures, DOS, etc.) from ab initio calculation outputs (VASP, Questaal, CASTEP).

name: M-SPARC
one_line_profile: MATLAB Simulation Package for Ab-initio Real-space Calculations
detailed_description: The MATLAB implementation of the SPARC electronic structure code, using real-space finite-difference methods for DFT calculations.

name: SPARC
one_line_profile: Simulation Package for Ab-initio Real-space Calculations
detailed_description: A high-performance C-based electronic structure code implementing real-space finite-difference methods for density functional theory.

name: CellConstructor
one_line_profile: Python utilities for atomic structure manipulation
detailed_description: A Python library for handling atomic structures, phonon calculations, and interfacing with Quantum ESPRESSO and other formats.

name: CoupledNMF

detailed_description: A Python tool for coupled Non-negative Matrix Factorization (NMF) clustering of single-cell genomic data.

name: XtraCrysPy
one_line_profile: Crystallographic visualizer for Python
detailed_description: A Python-based tool for visualizing crystallographic structures and data from common quantum chemistry software like Quantum ESPRESSO, VASP, and CP2K.

name: CheMPS2
one_line_profile: Spin-adapted DMRG for ab initio quantum chemistry
detailed_description: A C++ library and application implementing the spin-adapted Density Matrix Renormalization Group (DMRG) algorithm for ab initio quantum chemistry.

name: QC-DMET
one_line_profile: Density Matrix Embedding Theory implementation
detailed_description: A Python implementation of Density Matrix Embedding Theory (DMET) for performing ab initio quantum chemistry calculations.

name: Merlin
one_line_profile: 3D Vision Language Model for computed tomography analysis
detailed_description: Merlin is a 3D Vision Language Model (VLM) designed for computed tomography (CT) scans. It utilizes structured electronic health records (EHR) and unstructured radiology reports for pretraining to enhance medical imaging analysis.

name: SpecDis
one_line_profile: Processing tool for quantum-chemical ECD/UV/ORD/VCD/IR calculations
detailed_description: SpecDis is a tool designed to process and visualize results from quantum-chemical calculations such as ECD, UV, ORD, VCD, and IR spectra. It supports output formats from various packages including ORCA, Gaussian, Turbomole, and NWChem.

name: MPQC
one_line_profile: Massively Parallel Quantum Chemistry program
detailed_description: MPQC (Massively Parallel Quantum Chemistry) is an ab initio quantum chemistry program designed to compute properties of atoms and molecules using the time-independent Schrdinger equation, optimized for massively parallel architectures.

name: VeloxChem
one_line_profile: Python-based quantum chemistry software for molecular properties
detailed_description: VeloxChem is a Python-based open-source quantum chemistry software designed for computing molecular properties and various spectroscopies using response theory, with a focus on high-performance computing.

name: PythonGroupAdditivity
one_line_profile: First-Principles Semi-Empirical Group Additivity method
detailed_description: A Python implementation of the First-Principles Semi-Empirical (FPSE) Group Additivity (GA) method for estimating thermodynamic properties of molecules, developed by the Vlachos Group.

name: workfunction
one_line_profile: Planar averaged electrostatic potential calculator for VASP
detailed_description: A Fortran tool to calculate the planar averaged electrostatic potential from VASP outputs, typically used for work function calculations in surface science.

name: phononTB
one_line_profile: Phonon tight-binding model construction and topological property calculation
detailed_description: A Python tool to construct phonon tight-binding models and calculate their topological properties, facilitating the study of phonon band structures.

name: GradDFT
one_line_profile: JAX-based library for differentiable design of XC functionals
detailed_description: GradDFT is a JAX-based library that enables the differentiable design and experimentation of exchange-correlation functionals in Density Functional Theory (DFT) using machine learning techniques.

name: EHRStruct
one_line_profile: Benchmark framework for evaluating LLMs on structured EHR tasks
detailed_description: EHRStruct is a comprehensive benchmark framework designed to evaluate the performance of Large Language Models (LLMs) on tasks involving structured Electronic Health Records (EHR).

name: TBmodels
one_line_profile: Tool for creating and manipulating tight-binding models
detailed_description: TBmodels is a Python tool for creating, manipulating, and evaluating tight-binding models, often used in conjunction with first-principles calculations to study electronic properties.

name: fcdmft
one_line_profile: Ab initio full cell dynamical mean-field theory (DMFT) code
detailed_description: fcdmft implements ab initio full cell dynamical mean-field theory (DMFT) and GW+DMFT methods for calculating electronic properties of solids, developed by the Zhu Group at Yale.

name: kccgf
one_line_profile: Periodic coupled-cluster Green's function for solids
detailed_description: kccgf is a code for performing periodic coupled-cluster Green's function calculations for realistic solids, developed by the Zhu Group at Yale.

name: abTEM
one_line_profile: Ab initio Transmission Electron Microscopy simulation
detailed_description: abTEM is a Python code for ab initio simulations of Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM) images and diffraction patterns, providing a flexible interface for electron microscopy simulations.

name: ABACUS

detailed_description: ABACUS (Atomic-orbital Based Ab-initio Computation at UStc) is an electronic structure package based on Density Functional Theory (DFT) that supports both plane wave and numerical atomic orbital basis sets.

name: AMLP

detailed_description: AMLP integrates dataset creation, input/output handling, and analysis for machine learning interatomic potentials. It supports interfaces with Gaussian, VASP, and CP2K and includes LLM agents for code selection.

name: Quantum ESPRESSO (AdvanceSoft)
one_line_profile: Redistributed binaries and sources of Quantum ESPRESSO
detailed_description: This repository contains compiled binaries and source code for Quantum ESPRESSO, an integrated suite of Open-Source computer codes for electronic-structure calculations and materials modeling at the nanoscale.

name: aiidalab-qe
one_line_profile: AiiDAlab App for Quantum ESPRESSO
detailed_description: AiiDAlab-QE is an application for the AiiDAlab platform that provides a graphical interface and workflow management for running Quantum ESPRESSO calculations.

name: aiida-cp2k

detailed_description: The official AiiDA plugin for CP2K, enabling the integration of CP2K calculations into AiiDA workflows for automated and reproducible computational chemistry.

name: aiida-quantumespresso

detailed_description: The official AiiDA plugin for Quantum ESPRESSO, allowing for the automation and management of Quantum ESPRESSO calculations within the AiiDA framework.

name: qe-tools

detailed_description: A collection of Python tools for parsing and manipulating Quantum ESPRESSO input and output files, often used in conjunction with AiiDA.

name: ANI1x_datasets

one_line_profile: Genetic Algorithm Machine Learning for force field parameterization
detailed_description: A software package that utilizes genetic algorithms to automate the parameterization of force fields for molecular simulations.

name: charge_transfer_nnp
one_line_profile: Graph neural network potential with charge transfer
detailed_description: A Graph Neural Network based interatomic potential that explicitly models charge transfer effects for more accurate atomistic simulations.

name: e3tools
one_line_profile: Building blocks for equivariant neural networks in PyTorch
detailed_description: A library providing modular components for building E(3)-equivariant neural networks, designed to work with e3nn and PyTorch. Developed by Prescient Design (Genentech), it facilitates the creation of geometric deep learning models for molecular and structural biology applications.

name: MACE-Osaka24
one_line_profile: Pre-trained MACE models for molecular dynamics
detailed_description: A collection of pre-trained Machine Learning Force Field (MACE) models provided by the Quantum Information and Quantum Biology division at Osaka University. These models serve as ready-to-use potentials for molecular dynamics simulations.

name: rPPG-Toolbox
one_line_profile: Benchmark framework for remote photoplethysmography (rPPG)
detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmarking framework for evaluating remote photoplethysmography (rPPG) methods. It provides tools for data preprocessing, model training, and evaluation of physiological signal extraction from video, supporting fair comparisons in biomedical signal processing research.

name: VERTEX
one_line_profile: Virtual Electrode Recording Tool for EXtracellular potentials
detailed_description: A MATLAB-based simulator for spatially realistic Local Field Potential (LFP) simulation in spiking neural networks. It allows researchers to model extracellular potentials generated by large populations of neurons.

name: TorchANI-Amber
one_line_profile: Interface for using ANI neural network potentials in Amber MD
detailed_description: An interface developed by the Roitberg group that enables the use of ANI-style and other neural network interatomic potentials (NN-IPs) within the Amber molecular dynamics software suite. It bridges machine learning potentials with established MD engines.

name: CUDA-MACE
one_line_profile: CUDA accelerated implementation of MACE models
detailed_description: A high-performance CUDA implementation for MACE (Machine Learning Force Fields) models, designed to accelerate inference and simulation tasks involving equivariant neural network potentials on GPU hardware.

name: GotenNet
one_line_profile: Efficient 3D Equivariant Graph Neural Networks
detailed_description: Official implementation of GotenNet (ICLR 2025), a graph neural network architecture designed for efficiency and 3D equivariance. It is applicable to tasks involving 3D molecular structures and geometric deep learning.

name: LorentzNet
one_line_profile: Lorentz Equivariant Graph Neural Network for Jet Tagging
detailed_description: An efficient Lorentz equivariant graph neural network designed for particle physics applications, specifically jet tagging. It respects the symmetries of spacetime (Lorentz symmetry) to improve performance on high-energy physics data.

name: Simple-Equivariant-GNN
one_line_profile: Implementation of E(n) Equivariant Graph Neural Networks
detailed_description: A concise and accessible PyTorch implementation of E(n) Equivariant Graph Neural Networks (EGNN). It serves as a building block or reference for researchers developing geometric deep learning models for particle systems and molecules.

name: QHFlow
one_line_profile: DFT Hamiltonian prediction using flow models
detailed_description: Official implementation of QHFlow (NeurIPS '25), a machine learning model for predicting Density Functional Theory (DFT) Hamiltonians. It aims to accelerate quantum chemistry calculations by bypassing expensive self-consistent field iterations.

name: eqnn-jax
one_line_profile: JAX implementations of equivariant GNNs (EGNN, SEGNN, NequIP)
detailed_description: A collection of annotated implementations of popular equivariant graph neural networks (EGNN, SEGNN, NequIP) using JAX. It provides a high-performance codebase for researchers working on geometric deep learning in physics and chemistry.

name: sGDML
one_line_profile: Symmetric Gradient Domain Machine Learning model
detailed_description: The reference implementation of the Symmetric Gradient Domain Machine Learning (sGDML) model. It is a machine learning method for constructing accurate and efficient force fields from ab initio molecular dynamics data, incorporating physical symmetries.

name: Coronary-Mesh-Convolution
one_line_profile: Mesh neural networks for artery wall hemodynamics
detailed_description: An implementation of mesh neural networks for SE(3)-equivariant estimation of hemodynamic parameters on coronary artery walls. It applies geometric deep learning to biomedical fluid dynamics simulations.

name: TensorFlow Quantum
one_line_profile: Framework for hybrid quantum-classical machine learning
detailed_description: An open-source library for hybrid quantum-classical machine learning. It integrates quantum computing algorithms and logic designed in Cirq with TensorFlow, enabling the development of quantum machine learning models for scientific discovery.

name: mlff
one_line_profile: JAX-based library for machine learning force fields
detailed_description: A Python library built on JAX for training and evaluating neural network force fields. It provides tools for developing machine learning potentials to accelerate molecular dynamics simulations.

name: MDDatasetBuilder
one_line_profile: Tool to build reference datasets for NN potentials from LAMMPS
detailed_description: A utility script designed to construct reference datasets for training neural network potentials by processing LAMMPS trajectory files. It streamlines the data preparation workflow for machine learning force fields.

name: TorchMD-Net

detailed_description: TorchMD-NET provides state-of-the-art equivariant neural network architectures (like ET-Transformer) for training interatomic potentials and force fields, integrated with the TorchMD ecosystem.

name: GrouPy

detailed_description: A Python library for implementing Group Equivariant Convolutional Neural Networks (G-CNNs), which are essential for building symmetry-preserving models in scientific computing and geometric deep learning.

name: ChemTrain

detailed_description: ChemTrain allows training of neural network potentials (NNPs) against various experimental observables (not just energies/forces) using differentiable molecular dynamics and customizable routines in JAX.

name: DiffTre

detailed_description: A tool for learning neural network potentials from experimental data using Differentiable Trajectory Reweighting, enabling the optimization of force fields to match macroscopic observables.

name: Finetuna

detailed_description: Finetuna automates the active learning cycle for training machine learning potentials, selecting configurations that maximize model improvement for efficient force field generation.

name: AIMNet2

name: nb_conda_kernels

name: Apptainer

name: Singularity

detailed_description: The predecessor to Apptainer, widely used in scientific computing for creating and running containers that package scientific software and data.

name: Bactopia

detailed_description: A comprehensive Nextflow pipeline for bacterial genome analysis, including quality control, assembly, and annotation.

name: unidep

detailed_description: A tool to manage dependencies for scientific Python projects, handling both pip and conda requirements in a single file to ensure reproducibility.

name: apptainer-conda

detailed_description: A tool that facilitates the creation and usage of Conda environments encapsulated within Apptainer containers, enhancing reproducibility in HPC.

name: rrtools

detailed_description: A package that provides instructions, templates, and functions for making a compendium suitable for writing reproducible research with R.

name: Master of Pores

detailed_description: A pipeline for processing direct RNA sequencing data from Nanopore, including basecalling, mapping, and modification detection.

name: Graph-Mamba

detailed_description: A deep learning model adapting the Mamba architecture for graph data, applicable to molecular modeling and other scientific graph problems.

name: U-Mamba

detailed_description: A hybrid CNN-Mamba network for biomedical image segmentation, capturing long-range dependencies efficiently.

name: irlba

detailed_description: A library for implicitly restarted Lanczos bidiagonalization augmented methods, widely used for dimensionality reduction in large-scale scientific data (e.g., genomics).

name: cmcrameri

detailed_description: A Python package providing Fabio Crameri's perceptually uniform colourmaps, designed to accurately represent scientific data without visual distortion.

name: CompareM2
one_line_profile: Microbial genomes-to-report pipeline
detailed_description: A pipeline for comparative genomics of microbial isolates, generating comprehensive reports from genomic data.

name: SMASH
one_line_profile: Massively parallel software for quantum chemistry calculations
detailed_description: Scalable Many-body Ab-initio Simulation code designed for massively parallel supercomputers to perform quantum chemistry calculations.

name: EasyBuild
one_line_profile: Software build and installation framework for HPC systems
detailed_description: EasyBuild is a software build and installation framework that allows you to manage (scientific) software on High Performance Computing (HPC) systems in an efficient way.

name: EasyBuild Framework
one_line_profile: Core Python framework for the EasyBuild software installation system
detailed_description: The core framework of EasyBuild, providing the logic for building and installing software in a structured and robust way on HPC systems.

name: py2spack
one_line_profile: Converter from Python packages to Spack recipes
detailed_description: A tool to automatically convert standard Python packages (PyPI) into Spack package recipes, facilitating the deployment of Python scientific stacks on HPC.

name: nixpack
one_line_profile: Integration of Nix and Spack for scientific software management
detailed_description: A tool that combines the Nix package manager with Spack to provide reproducible environments for scientific computing.

name: SegMamba
one_line_profile: 3D Medical Image Segmentation using Mamba architecture
detailed_description: A long-range sequential modeling framework based on Mamba for 3D medical image segmentation tasks.

name: Popper
one_line_profile: Container-native task automation engine for scientific reproducibility
detailed_description: A tool for defining and executing container-native workflows, specifically designed to support scientific reproducibility and experimentation pipelines.

name: HOOMD-blue
one_line_profile: Molecular dynamics and Monte Carlo simulation engine
detailed_description: A general-purpose particle simulation toolkit optimized for GPUs, supporting molecular dynamics and Monte Carlo simulations for soft matter research.

name: rstudio-server-conda
one_line_profile: Docker image running RStudio Server in a Conda environment
detailed_description: A specialized Docker image that integrates RStudio Server with Conda, allowing for reproducible scientific statistical analysis environments with managed dependencies.

name: guix-science
one_line_profile: Scientific package channel for GNU Guix
detailed_description: A channel for the GNU Guix package manager containing free scientific software packages, facilitating reproducible software deployment in HPC and research environments.

name: Cobra
one_line_profile: Multi-modal Large Language Model extending Mamba
detailed_description: An efficient multi-modal large language model architecture that extends the Mamba state space model for optimized inference in scientific and general AI tasks.

name: LocalMamba
one_line_profile: Visual State Space Model with Windowed Selective Scan
detailed_description: Implementation of a visual state space model that improves local dependency modeling in images, applicable to computer vision tasks in scientific analysis.

name: Vim (Vision Mamba)
one_line_profile: Bidirectional State Space Model for visual representation learning
detailed_description: A vision backbone architecture based on Mamba that offers efficient visual representation learning, suitable for high-resolution scientific image analysis.

name: Singularity-Model
one_line_profile: Video-and-Language Learning Model
detailed_description: Implementation of the Singularity model for revealing single frame bias in video-and-language learning, applicable to multimodal data analysis.

name: berryconda
one_line_profile: Conda distribution for Raspberry Pi
detailed_description: A Conda-based Python distribution specifically for Raspberry Pi, enabling scientific computing and package management on edge devices.

name: mamba-minimal
one_line_profile: Minimal PyTorch implementation of Mamba SSM
detailed_description: A concise and self-contained implementation of the Mamba State Space Model, serving as a reference solver for sequence modeling tasks.

name: apptainer-in-docker
one_line_profile: Run Apptainer within Docker containers
detailed_description: A tool enabling the use of Apptainer (formerly Singularity), the standard HPC container system, inside Docker environments, facilitating CI/CD for scientific workflows.

name: key4hep-spack
one_line_profile: Spack recipes for Key4hep software stack
detailed_description: A repository of Spack package recipes for the Key4hep project, enabling the deployment of consistent software stacks for High Energy Physics.

name: pymssa
one_line_profile: Multivariate Singular Spectrum Analysis implementation
detailed_description: A Python library implementing Multivariate Singular Spectrum Analysis (MSSA) for time series decomposition and forecasting in scientific data analysis.

name: MultiModalMamba
one_line_profile: Fused ViT and Mamba Multi-Modal Model
detailed_description: An implementation fusing Vision Transformers with Mamba architecture for high-performance multi-modal AI modeling.

name: VisionMamba
one_line_profile: Efficient Visual Representation Learning with Bidirectional SSM
detailed_description: Implementation of the Vision Mamba architecture for efficient visual representation learning, offering faster inference and lower memory usage for image analysis.

name: MobileMamba
one_line_profile: Lightweight Multi-Receptive Visual Mamba Network
detailed_description: A lightweight implementation of the Visual Mamba network optimized for mobile or resource-constrained environments in computer vision tasks.

name: libigl-python-bindings
one_line_profile: Python bindings for libigl geometry processing library
detailed_description: Python interface for libigl, a comprehensive C++ library for geometry processing, mesh manipulation, and scientific visualization.

name: crocoddyl
one_line_profile: Optimal control library for robot control
detailed_description: A library for optimal control of complex systems, specifically robots, using Differential Dynamic Programming (DDP) algorithms.

name: boa
one_line_profile: Fast Conda package builder based on Mamba
detailed_description: A tool for building Conda packages using the Mamba solver, significantly speeding up the package creation process for scientific software distribution.

name: Gator
one_line_profile: Jupyter extension for managing Conda environments and packages within the notebook interface
detailed_description: Gator is a Jupyter extension that provides a graphical interface for Conda environment management directly within JupyterLab and Jupyter Notebook. It allows researchers to create, update, and manage scientific software environments without leaving their data analysis workspace, enhancing reproducibility and workflow efficiency.

name: Mamba
one_line_profile: High-performance, cross-platform package manager for scientific computing environments
detailed_description: Mamba is a reimplementation of the Conda package manager in C++, designed to drastically improve the speed of dependency solving and package installation. It is a critical tool in the scientific Python and R ecosystem for creating reproducible environments for high-performance computing and data science.

name: micromamba-docker
one_line_profile: Infrastructure for building minimal, reproducible Conda-based containers
detailed_description: This repository provides the tooling and base images for creating small, efficient Docker containers using Micromamba. It is essential for deploying scientific applications in containerized HPC and cloud environments, ensuring consistent runtime environments for research software.

name: Quetz
one_line_profile: Open-source server for hosting and managing Conda package channels
detailed_description: Quetz is a server implementation for Conda packages, allowing scientific organizations to host private or public package channels. It supports artifact management, access control, and metadata handling, serving as a foundational platform for distributing scientific software within research groups.

name: Syndeo
one_line_profile: Orchestration tool for running Ray workloads on Slurm with Apptainer
detailed_description: Syndeo enables the execution of massively parallel jobs using the Ray framework on Slurm-managed HPC clusters. It leverages Apptainer for secure containerization, bridging modern AI compute frameworks with traditional scientific HPC schedulers.

name: mp-units
one_line_profile: C++ library for dimensional analysis and physical unit systems
detailed_description: mp-units is a compile-time dimensional analysis library for C++ that enforces type safety for physical quantities. It is critical for scientific modeling and simulation software to prevent unit conversion errors and ensure physical correctness in calculations.

name: repo2apptainer
one_line_profile: Tool to convert repositories into Apptainer images for HPC reproducibility
detailed_description: Repo2apptainer is a wrapper around repo2docker that generates Apptainer (formerly Singularity) images from source repositories. It facilitates the transfer of reproducible computational environments from local development (Jupyter) to HPC clusters.

name: Nextflow
one_line_profile: Workflow orchestration engine for data-driven computational pipelines
detailed_description: Nextflow is a domain-specific language and runtime for defining and executing complex computational pipelines. It abstracts the underlying compute infrastructure (HPC, Cloud, Kubernetes) and is the standard for building reproducible scientific workflows, particularly in bioinformatics and data science.

name: Sarek
one_line_profile: Comprehensive pipeline for germline and somatic variant calling
detailed_description: Sarek is a production-grade analysis pipeline built with Nextflow for detecting germline or somatic variants from whole genome or targeted sequencing data. It integrates multiple scientific tools (GATK, Strelka, etc.) into a reproducible workflow.

name: PRIMME
one_line_profile: High-performance library for solving large-scale Hermitian eigenvalue and singular value problems
detailed_description: PReconditioned Iterative MultiMethod Eigensolver. A high-performance library for computing a few eigenvalues/eigenvectors and singular values/vectors, essential for quantum chemistry and physics simulations.

name: PyAMG
one_line_profile: Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solvers for large sparse linear systems in Python
detailed_description: A library of Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solvers for large sparse linear systems, commonly used in scientific simulations like fluid dynamics and physics modeling.

name: What the Phage
one_line_profile: Reproducible workflow for bacteriophage identification and annotation
detailed_description: A Nextflow-based bioinformatics workflow for easy-to-use and reproducible identification and annotation of bacteriophages from sequencing data.

name: law
one_line_profile: Workflow management system for large-scale physics analysis on HPC
detailed_description: A Python package to build large-scale task workflows based on Luigi, featuring remote job submission, remote targets, and environment sandboxing using Docker and Singularity, tailored for High Energy Physics.

name: spack-manager
one_line_profile: Management tool for Spack environments and deployments
detailed_description: A tool developed by Sandia National Laboratories to manage Spack environments and machine deployments, facilitating the maintenance of scientific software stacks on HPC systems.

name: Shogun
one_line_profile: Large-scale machine learning toolbox
detailed_description: A machine learning library with a focus on Support Vector Machines (SVMs) and kernel methods, historically widely used in bioinformatics and scientific data analysis.

name: docker2singularity
one_line_profile: Converter for Docker images to Singularity format
detailed_description: A tool (packaged as a Docker image) to convert Docker images into Singularity images, essential for migrating containerized scientific workflows to HPC environments.

name: singularity-hpc

detailed_description: A tool to manage a local filesystem registry for Singularity containers on HPC, automatically generating Lmod or Environment Modules to make containers accessible as modules.

name: sregistry
one_line_profile: Singularity image registry server
detailed_description: An open-source registry server and client for managing and storing Singularity images, designed for scientific institutions to host their own container collections.

name: Spack

detailed_description: A multi-platform package manager that supports multiple versions, configurations, platforms, and compilers, specifically designed to handle the complex dependency graphs of scientific software on HPC systems.

name: Pinocchio
one_line_profile: Rigid body dynamics algorithms library
detailed_description: A fast and flexible C++ library (with Python bindings) for rigid body dynamics algorithms and their analytical derivatives, widely used in robotics and biomechanics research.

name: SingularityCE

detailed_description: The Community Edition of Singularity, a container platform designed for High Performance Computing (HPC) environments, enabling reproducible scientific workflows with support for MPI and specialized hardware.

name: Banpei

detailed_description: A Python library implementing Singular Spectrum Transformation (SST) for change-point detection in time-series data, applicable to signal processing and data analysis tasks.

detailed_description: A comprehensive RNA-Seq analysis workflow covering read quantification, differential expression analysis, and pathway enrichment, designed for transcriptomics research.

detailed_description: Implementation of UltraLight VM-UNet, a lightweight medical image segmentation model combining Vision Mamba and U-Net architectures for efficient skin lesion analysis.

detailed_description: Implementation of a State Space Model (Mamba) adapted for time series forecasting tasks, evaluating the effectiveness of SSMs in temporal data analysis.

detailed_description: A tool for extracting reaction templates from chemical reaction data using a graph-based approach.

name: rxnfp

name: LocalMapper

name: ORDerly

name: AutoWRFChem-Base

name: Equivariant-Graph-Transformer

name: MPerformer

name: t5chem

name: TyphoFormer

name: Organic Reaction Prediction NMT

name: Levenshtein SMILES Augmentation

detailed_description: A Python utility for augmenting reaction SMILES datasets by applying Levenshtein distance-based modifications, developed by MolecularAI (AstraZeneca) to improve robustness of chemical reaction models.

name: Deep Molecular Optimization

name: EvalRetro

detailed_description: A comprehensive repository for evaluating and benchmarking various single-step retrosynthesis prediction algorithms, providing standardized metrics and datasets for chemical synthesis research.

name: SiGra

detailed_description: A tool for single-cell spatial analysis that integrates histology images and gene expression data using a graph transformer model to elucidate spatial domains and cell-cell interactions.

name: GET

detailed_description: Implementation of the Generalist Equivariant Transformer (GET) for modeling 3D molecular interactions, applicable to tasks like protein-ligand binding and molecular property prediction.

name: MEGANet
